title.narrative: Housing for Integrated Rural Development Investment Program - Tranche 3

description.narrative: The Housing for Integrated Rural Development (HIRD) Investment Program is a five-year, $500 million multitranche financing facility (MFF) approved in 2011. Under component 1, new modern houses are built in planned rural community sites, on land plots serviced with electricity, gas, water supply, and roads provided by local governments. ADB loans to the government are onlent to participating commercial banks (PCBs) that provide subloans to rural residents who enter into contracts with Qishloq Qurilish Invest (QQI) to build new houses. Under the MFF, ADB has financed 19,606 subloans. Under component 2, the capacity of local governments to prepare and implement integrated rural development plans and investment promotion strategies is being improved. Component 2 is financed entirely by the government. Under component 3, the government is implementing measures to improve the enabling environment for entrepreneurs and micro and small enterprises to expand or establish new businesses in rural areas. Component 3 is also financed entirely by the government. A third tranche of $100 million to fund mortgages for houses was approved in 2015. ADB procurement procedures was followed for the main civil works contracts for houses and implemented nationwide involving local governments and using other institutional arrangements and structures practiced in public procurement.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Economic Development and Poverty Reduction

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: downstreaming of rural housing scheme for moderate-and lower- income beneficiaries, with a focus on women

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
At least 26,070 applicants in 2015 for housing loans under the scheme, of which at least 7,851 are selected as targeted beneficiaries (home buyers) by December 2015.

description.narrative: downstreaming of rural housing scheme for moderate-and lower- income beneficiaries, with a focus on women

title.narrative: Use of defined beneficiary selection criteria, public awareness campaign, social prioritization of applicants, one year post-construction warranty, grievance process, and monitoring framework by September 2016

description.narrative: downstreaming of rural housing scheme for moderate-and lower- income beneficiaries, with a focus on women
